32#include <sys/cdefs.h>
33__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: linux_reservation.c,v 1.11 2018/09/03 18:02:11 riastradh Exp $");
34
35#include <sys/param.h>
36#include <sys/poll.h>
37#include <sys/select.h>
38
39#include <linux/fence.h>
40#include <linux/reservation.h>
41#include <linux/ww_mutex.h>
42
43DEFINE_WW_CLASS(reservation_ww_class __cacheline_aligned);
44
45static struct reservation_object_list *
46objlist_tryalloc(uint32_t n)
47{
48 struct reservation_object_list *list;
49
50 list = kmem_alloc(offsetof(typeof(*list), shared[n]), KM_NOSLEEP);
51 if (list == NULL)
52 return NULL;
53 list->shared_max = n;
54
55 return list;
56}
57
58static void
59objlist_free(struct reservation_object_list *list)
60{
61 uint32_t n = list->shared_max;
62
63 kmem_free(list, offsetof(typeof(*list), shared[n]));
64}
65
66static void
67objlist_free_cb(struct rcu_head *rcu)
68{
69 struct reservation_object_list *list = container_of(rcu,
70 struct reservation_object_list, rol_rcu);
71
72 objlist_free(list);
73}
74
75static void
76objlist_defer_free(struct reservation_object_list *list)
77{
78
79 call_rcu(&list->rol_rcu, objlist_free_cb);
80}
81
82/*
83 * reservation_object_init(robj)
84 *
85 * Initialize a reservation object. Caller must later destroy it
86 * with reservation_object_fini.
87 */
88void
89reservation_object_init(struct reservation_object *robj)
90{
91
92 ww_mutex_init(&robj->lock, &reservation_ww_class);
93 robj->robj_version = 0;
94 robj->robj_fence = NULL;
95 robj->robj_list = NULL;
96 robj->robj_prealloc = NULL;
97}
98
99/*
100 * reservation_object_fini(robj)
101 *
102 * Destroy a reservation object, freeing any memory that had been
103 * allocated for it. Caller must have exclusive access to it.
104 */
105void
106reservation_object_fini(struct reservation_object *robj)
107{
108 unsigned i;
109
110 if (robj->robj_prealloc)
111 objlist_free(robj->robj_prealloc);
112 if (robj->robj_list) {
113 for (i = 0; i < robj->robj_list->shared_count; i++)
114 fence_put(robj->robj_list->shared[i]);
115 objlist_free(robj->robj_list);
116 }
117 if (robj->robj_fence)
118 fence_put(robj->robj_fence);
119 ww_mutex_destroy(&robj->lock);
120}
121
122/*
123 * reservation_object_held(roj)
124 *
125 * True if robj is locked.
126 */
127bool
128reservation_object_held(struct reservation_object *robj)
129{
130
131 return ww_mutex_is_locked(&robj->lock);
132}
133
134/*
135 * reservation_object_get_excl(robj)
136 *
137 * Return a pointer to the exclusive fence of the reservation
138 * object robj.
139 *
140 * Caller must have robj locked.
141 */
142struct fence *
143reservation_object_get_excl(struct reservation_object *robj)
144{
145
146 KASSERT(reservation_object_held(robj));
147 return robj->robj_fence;
148}
149
150/*
151 * reservation_object_get_list(robj)
152 *
153 * Return a pointer to the shared fence list of the reservation
154 * object robj.
155 *
156 * Caller must have robj locked.
157 */
158struct reservation_object_list *
159reservation_object_get_list(struct reservation_object *robj)
160{
161
162 KASSERT(reservation_object_held(robj));
163 return robj->robj_list;
164}
165
166/*
167 * reservation_object_reserve_shared(robj)
168 *
169 * Reserve space in robj to add a shared fence. To be used only
170 * once before calling reservation_object_add_shared_fence.
171 *
172 * Caller must have robj locked.
173 *
174 * Internally, we start with room for four entries and double if
175 * we don't have enough. This is not guaranteed.
176 */
177int
178reservation_object_reserve_shared(struct reservation_object *robj)
179{
180 struct reservation_object_list *list, *prealloc;
181 uint32_t n, nalloc;
182
183 KASSERT(reservation_object_held(robj));
184
185 list = robj->robj_list;
186 prealloc = robj->robj_prealloc;
187
188 /* If there's an existing list, check it for space. */
189 if (list != NULL) {
190 /* If there's too many already, give up. */
191 if (list->shared_count == UINT32_MAX)
192 return -ENOMEM;
193
194 /* Add one more. */
195 n = list->shared_count + 1;
196
197 /* If there's enough for one more, we're done. */
198 if (n <= list->shared_max)
199 return 0;
200 } else {
201 /* No list already. We need space for 1. */
202 n = 1;
203 }
204
205 /* If not, maybe there's a preallocated list ready. */
206 if (prealloc != NULL) {
207 /* If there's enough room in it, stop here. */
208 if (n <= prealloc->shared_max)
209 return 0;
210
211 /* Try to double its capacity. */
212 nalloc = n > UINT32_MAX/2 ? UINT32_MAX : 2*n;
213 prealloc = objlist_tryalloc(nalloc);
214 if (prealloc == NULL)
215 return -ENOMEM;
216
217 /* Swap the new preallocated list and free the old one. */
218 objlist_free(robj->robj_prealloc);
219 robj->robj_prealloc = prealloc;
220 } else {
221 /* Start with some spare. */
222 nalloc = n > UINT32_MAX/2 ? UINT32_MAX : MAX(2*n, 4);
223 prealloc = objlist_tryalloc(nalloc);
224 if (prealloc == NULL)
225 return -ENOMEM;
226 /* Save the new preallocated list. */
227 robj->robj_prealloc = prealloc;
228 }
229
230 /* Success! */
231 return 0;
232}
233
234struct reservation_object_write_ticket {
235 unsigned version;
236};
237
238/*
239 * reservation_object_write_begin(robj, ticket)
240 *
241 * Begin an atomic batch of writes to robj, and initialize opaque
242 * ticket for it. The ticket must be passed to
243 * reservation_object_write_commit to commit the writes.
244 *
245 * Caller must have robj locked.
246 */
247static void
248reservation_object_write_begin(struct reservation_object *robj,
249 struct reservation_object_write_ticket *ticket)
250{
251
252 KASSERT(reservation_object_held(robj));
253
254 ticket->version = robj->robj_version |= 1;
255 membar_producer();
256}
257
258/*
259 * reservation_object_write_commit(robj, ticket)
260 *
261 * Commit an atomic batch of writes to robj begun with the call to
262 * reservation_object_write_begin that returned ticket.
263 *
264 * Caller must have robj locked.
265 */
266static void
267reservation_object_write_commit(struct reservation_object *robj,
268 struct reservation_object_write_ticket *ticket)
269{
270
271 KASSERT(reservation_object_held(robj));
272 KASSERT(ticket->version == robj->robj_version);
273 KASSERT((ticket->version & 1) == 1);
274
275 membar_producer();
276 robj->robj_version = ticket->version + 1;
277}
278
279struct reservation_object_read_ticket {
280 unsigned version;
281};
282
283/*
284 * reservation_object_read_begin(robj, ticket)
285 *
286 * Begin a read section, and initialize opaque ticket for it. The
287 * ticket must be passed to reservation_object_read_exit, and the
288 * caller must be prepared to retry reading if it fails.
289 */
290static void
291reservation_object_read_begin(struct reservation_object *robj,
292 struct reservation_object_read_ticket *ticket)
293{
294
295 while ((ticket->version = robj->robj_version) & 1)
296 SPINLOCK_BACKOFF_HOOK;
297 membar_consumer();
298}
299
300/*
301 * reservation_object_read_valid(robj, ticket)
302 *
303 * Test whether the read sections are valid. Return true on
304 * success, or false on failure if the read ticket has been
305 * invalidated.
306 */
307static bool
308reservation_object_read_valid(struct reservation_object *robj,
309 struct reservation_object_read_ticket *ticket)
310{
311
312 membar_consumer();
313 return ticket->version == robj->robj_version;
314}
315
316/*
317 * reservation_object_add_excl_fence(robj, fence)
318 *
319 * Empty and release all of robj's shared fences, and clear and
320 * release its exclusive fence. If fence is nonnull, acquire a
321 * reference to it and save it as robj's exclusive fence.
322 *
323 * Caller must have robj locked.
324 */
325void
326reservation_object_add_excl_fence(struct reservation_object *robj,
327 struct fence *fence)
328{
329 struct fence *old_fence = robj->robj_fence;
330 struct reservation_object_list *old_list = robj->robj_list;
331 uint32_t old_shared_count;
332 struct reservation_object_write_ticket ticket;
333
334 KASSERT(reservation_object_held(robj));
335
336 /*
337 * If we are setting rather than just removing a fence, acquire
338 * a reference for ourselves.
339 */
340 if (fence)
341 (void)fence_get(fence);
342
343 /* If there are any shared fences, remember how many. */
344 if (old_list)
345 old_shared_count = old_list->shared_count;
346
347 /* Begin an update. */
348 reservation_object_write_begin(robj, &ticket);
349
350 /* Replace the fence and zero the shared count. */
351 robj->robj_fence = fence;
352 if (old_list)
353 old_list->shared_count = 0;
354
355 /* Commit the update. */
356 reservation_object_write_commit(robj, &ticket);
357
358 /* Release the old exclusive fence, if any. */
359 if (old_fence)
360 fence_put(old_fence);
361
362 /* Release any old shared fences. */
363 if (old_list) {
364 while (old_shared_count--)
365 fence_put(old_list->shared[old_shared_count]);
366 }
367}
368
369/*
370 * reservation_object_add_shared_fence(robj, fence)
371 *
372 * Acquire a reference to fence and add it to robj's shared list.
373 * If any fence was already added with the same context number,
374 * release it and replace it by this one.
375 *
376 * Caller must have robj locked, and must have preceded with a
377 * call to reservation_object_reserve_shared for each shared fence
378 * added.
379 */
380void
381reservation_object_add_shared_fence(struct reservation_object *robj,
382 struct fence *fence)
383{
384 struct reservation_object_list *list = robj->robj_list;
385 struct reservation_object_list *prealloc = robj->robj_prealloc;
386 struct reservation_object_write_ticket ticket;
387 struct fence *replace = NULL;
388 uint32_t i;
389
390 KASSERT(reservation_object_held(robj));
391
392 /* Acquire a reference to the fence. */
393 KASSERT(fence != NULL);
394 (void)fence_get(fence);
395
396 /* Check for a preallocated replacement list. */
397 if (prealloc == NULL) {
398 /*
399 * If there is no preallocated replacement list, then
400 * there must be room in the current list.
401 */
402 KASSERT(list != NULL);
403 KASSERT(list->shared_count < list->shared_max);
404
405 /* Begin an update. */
406 reservation_object_write_begin(robj, &ticket);
407
408 /* Find a fence with the same context number. */
409 for (i = 0; i < list->shared_count; i++) {
410 if (list->shared[i]->context == fence->context) {
411 replace = list->shared[i];
412 list->shared[i] = fence;
413 break;
414 }
415 }
416
417 /* If we didn't find one, add it at the end. */
418 if (i == list->shared_count)
419 list->shared[list->shared_count++] = fence;
420
421 /* Commit the update. */
422 reservation_object_write_commit(robj, &ticket);
423 } else {
424 /*
425 * There is a preallocated replacement list. There may
426 * not be a current list. If not, treat it as a zero-
427 * length list.
428 */
429 uint32_t shared_count = (list == NULL? 0 : list->shared_count);
430
431 /* There had better be room in the preallocated list. */
432 KASSERT(shared_count < prealloc->shared_max);
433
434 /*
435 * Copy the fences over, but replace if we find one
436 * with the same context number.
437 */
438 for (i = 0; i < shared_count; i++) {
439 if (replace == NULL &&
440 list->shared[i]->context == fence->context) {
441 replace = list->shared[i];
442 prealloc->shared[i] = fence;
443 } else {
444 prealloc->shared[i] = list->shared[i];
445 }
446 }
447 prealloc->shared_count = shared_count;
448
449 /* If we didn't find one, add it at the end. */
450 if (replace == NULL)
451 prealloc->shared[prealloc->shared_count++] = fence;
452
453 /* Now ready to replace the list. Begin an update. */
454 reservation_object_write_begin(robj, &ticket);
455
456 /* Replace the list. */
457 robj->robj_list = prealloc;
458 robj->robj_prealloc = NULL;
459
460 /* Commit the update. */
461 reservation_object_write_commit(robj, &ticket);
462
463 /*
464 * If there is an old list, free it when convenient.
465 * (We are not in a position at this point to sleep
466 * waiting for activity on all CPUs.)
467 */
468 if (list != NULL)
469 objlist_defer_free(list);
470 }
471
472 /* Release a fence if we replaced it. */
473 if (replace)
474 fence_put(replace);
475}
476
477int
478reservation_object_get_fences_rcu(struct reservation_object *robj,
479 struct fence **fencep, unsigned *nsharedp, struct fence ***sharedp)
480{
481 struct reservation_object_list *list;
482 struct fence *fence;
483 struct fence **shared = NULL;
484 unsigned shared_alloc, shared_count, i;
485 struct reservation_object_read_ticket ticket;
486
487top:
488 /* Enter an RCU read section and get a read ticket. */
489 rcu_read_lock();
490 reservation_object_read_begin(robj, &ticket);
491
492 /* If there is a shared list, grab it. */
493 if ((list = robj->robj_list) != NULL) {
494 /* Make sure the content of the list has been published. */
495 membar_datadep_consumer();
496
497 /* Check whether we have a buffer. */
498 if (shared == NULL) {
499 /*
500 * We don't have a buffer yet. Try to allocate
501 * one without waiting.
502 */
503 shared_alloc = list->shared_max;
504 __insn_barrier();
505 shared = kcalloc(shared_alloc, sizeof(shared[0]),
506 GFP_NOWAIT);
507 if (shared == NULL) {
508 /*
509 * Couldn't do it immediately. Back
510 * out of RCU and allocate one with
511 * waiting.
512 */
513 rcu_read_unlock();
514 shared = kcalloc(shared_alloc,
515 sizeof(shared[0]), GFP_KERNEL);
516 if (shared == NULL)
517 return -ENOMEM;
518 goto top;
519 }
520 } else if (shared_alloc < list->shared_max) {
521 /*
522 * We have a buffer but it's too small. We're
523 * already racing in this case, so just back
524 * out and wait to allocate a bigger one.
525 */
526 shared_alloc = list->shared_max;
527 __insn_barrier();
528 rcu_read_unlock();
529 kfree(shared);
530 shared = kcalloc(shared_alloc, sizeof(shared[0]),
531 GFP_KERNEL);
532 if (shared == NULL)
533 return -ENOMEM;
534 }
535
536 /*
537 * We got a buffer large enough. Copy into the buffer
538 * and record the number of elements.
539 */
540 memcpy(shared, list->shared, shared_alloc * sizeof(shared[0]));
541 shared_count = list->shared_count;
542 } else {
543 /* No shared list: shared count is zero. */
544 shared_count = 0;
545 }
546
547 /* If there is an exclusive fence, grab it. */
548 if ((fence = robj->robj_fence) != NULL) {
549 /* Make sure the content of the fence has been published. */
550 membar_datadep_consumer();
551 }
552
553 /*
554 * We are done reading from robj and list. Validate our
555 * parking ticket. If it's invalid, do not pass go and do not
556 * collect $200.
557 */
558 if (!reservation_object_read_valid(robj, &ticket))
559 goto restart;
560
561 /*
562 * Try to get a reference to the exclusive fence, if there is
563 * one. If we can't, start over.
564 */
565 if (fence) {
566 if (fence_get_rcu(fence) == NULL)
567 goto restart;
568 }
569
570 /*
571 * Try to get a reference to all of the shared fences.
572 */
573 for (i = 0; i < shared_count; i++) {
574 if (fence_get_rcu(shared[i]) == NULL)
575 goto put_restart;
576 }
577
578 /* Success! */
579 rcu_read_unlock();
580 *fencep = fence;
581 *nsharedp = shared_count;
582 *sharedp = shared;
583 return 0;
584
585put_restart:
586 /* Back out. */
587 while (i --> 0) {
588 fence_put(shared[i]);
589 shared[i] = NULL; /* paranoia */
590 }
591 if (fence) {
592 fence_put(fence);
593 fence = NULL; /* paranoia */
594 }
595
596restart:
597 rcu_read_unlock();
598 goto top;
599}
600
601/*
602 * reservation_object_test_signaled_rcu(robj, shared)
603 *
604 * If shared is true, test whether all of the shared fences are
605 * signalled, or if there are none, test whether the exclusive
606 * fence is signalled. If shared is false, test only whether the
607 * exclusive fence is signalled.
608 *
609 * XXX Why does this _not_ test the exclusive fence if shared is
610 * true only if there are no shared fences? This makes no sense.
611 */
612bool
613reservation_object_test_signaled_rcu(struct reservation_object *robj,
614 bool shared)
615{
616 struct reservation_object_read_ticket ticket;
617 struct reservation_object_list *list;
618 struct fence *fence;
619 uint32_t i, shared_count;
620 bool signaled = true;
621
622top:
623 /* Enter an RCU read section and get a read ticket. */
624 rcu_read_lock();
625 reservation_object_read_begin(robj, &ticket);
626
627 /* If shared is requested and there is a shared list, test it. */
628 if (shared && (list = robj->robj_list) != NULL) {
629 /* Make sure the content of the list has been published. */
630 membar_datadep_consumer();
631
632 /* Find out how long it is. */
633 shared_count = list->shared_count;
634
635 /*
636 * Make sure we saw a consistent snapshot of the list
637 * pointer and length.
638 */
639 if (!reservation_object_read_valid(robj, &ticket))
640 goto restart;
641
642 /*
643 * For each fence, if it is going away, restart.
644 * Otherwise, acquire a reference to it to test whether
645 * it is signalled. Stop if we find any that is not
646 * signalled.
647 */
648 for (i = 0; i < shared_count; i++) {
649 fence = fence_get_rcu(list->shared[i]);
650 if (fence == NULL)
651 goto restart;
652 signaled &= fence_is_signaled(fence);
653 fence_put(fence);
654 if (!signaled)
655 goto out;
656 }
657 }
658
659 /* If there is an exclusive fence, test it. */
660 if ((fence = robj->robj_fence) != NULL) {
661 /* Make sure the content of the fence has been published. */
662 membar_datadep_consumer();
663
664 /*
665 * Make sure we saw a consistent snapshot of the fence.
666 *
667 * XXX I'm not actually sure this is necessary since
668 * pointer writes are supposed to be atomic.
669 */
670 if (!reservation_object_read_valid(robj, &ticket))
671 goto restart;
672
673 /*
674 * If it is going away, restart. Otherwise, acquire a
675 * reference to it to test whether it is signalled.
676 */
677 if ((fence = fence_get_rcu(fence)) == NULL)
678 goto restart;
679 signaled &= fence_is_signaled(fence);
680 fence_put(fence);
681 if (!signaled)
682 goto out;
683 }
684
685out: rcu_read_unlock();
686 return signaled;
687
688restart:
689 rcu_read_unlock();
690 goto top;
691}
692
693/*
694 * reservation_object_wait_timeout_rcu(robj, shared, intr, timeout)
695 *
696 * If shared is true, wait for all of the shared fences to be
697 * signalled, or if there are none, wait for the exclusive fence
698 * to be signalled. If shared is false, wait only for the
699 * exclusive fence to be signalled. If timeout is zero, don't
700 * wait, only test.
701 *
702 * XXX Why does this _not_ wait for the exclusive fence if shared
703 * is true only if there are no shared fences? This makes no
704 * sense.
705 */
706long
707reservation_object_wait_timeout_rcu(struct reservation_object *robj,
708 bool shared, bool intr, unsigned long timeout)
709{
710 struct reservation_object_read_ticket ticket;
711 struct reservation_object_list *list;
712 struct fence *fence;
713 uint32_t i, shared_count;
714 long ret;
715
716 if (timeout == 0)
717 return reservation_object_test_signaled_rcu(robj, shared);
718
719top:
720 /* Enter an RCU read section and get a read ticket. */
721 rcu_read_lock();
722 reservation_object_read_begin(robj, &ticket);
723
724 /* If shared is requested and there is a shared list, wait on it. */
725 if (shared && (list = robj->robj_list) != NULL) {
726 /* Make sure the content of the list has been published. */
727 membar_datadep_consumer();
728
729 /* Find out how long it is. */
730 shared_count = list->shared_count;
731
732 /*
733 * Make sure we saw a consistent snapshot of the list
734 * pointer and length.
735 */
736 if (!reservation_object_read_valid(robj, &ticket))
737 goto restart;
738
739 /*
740 * For each fence, if it is going away, restart.
741 * Otherwise, acquire a reference to it to test whether
742 * it is signalled. Stop and wait if we find any that
743 * is not signalled.
744 */
745 for (i = 0; i < shared_count; i++) {
746 fence = fence_get_rcu(list->shared[i]);
747 if (fence == NULL)
748 goto restart;
749 if (!fence_is_signaled(fence))
750 goto wait;
751 fence_put(fence);
752 }
753 }
754
755 /* If there is an exclusive fence, test it. */
756 if ((fence = robj->robj_fence) != NULL) {
757 /* Make sure the content of the fence has been published. */
758 membar_datadep_consumer();
759
760 /*
761 * Make sure we saw a consistent snapshot of the fence.
762 *
763 * XXX I'm not actually sure this is necessary since
764 * pointer writes are supposed to be atomic.
765 */
766 if (!reservation_object_read_valid(robj, &ticket))
767 goto restart;
768
769 /*
770 * If it is going away, restart. Otherwise, acquire a
771 * reference to it to test whether it is signalled. If
772 * not, wait for it.
773 */
774 if ((fence = fence_get_rcu(fence)) == NULL)
775 goto restart;
776 if (!fence_is_signaled(fence))
777 goto wait;
778 fence_put(fence);
779 }
780
781 /* Success! Return the number of ticks left. */
782 rcu_read_unlock();
783 return timeout;
784
785restart:
786 rcu_read_unlock();
787 goto top;
788
789wait:
790 /*
791 * Exit the RCU read section and wait for it. If we time out
792 * or fail, bail. Otherwise, go back to the top.
793 */
794 KASSERT(fence != NULL);
795 rcu_read_unlock();
796 ret = fence_wait_timeout(fence, intr, timeout);
797 if (ret <= 0)
798 return ret;
799 KASSERT(ret <= timeout);
800 timeout = ret;
801 goto top;
802}
803
804/*
805 * reservation_poll_init(rpoll, lock)
806 *
807 * Initialize reservation poll state.
808 */
809void
810reservation_poll_init(struct reservation_poll *rpoll)
811{
812
813 mutex_init(&rpoll->rp_lock, MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_VM);
814 selinit(&rpoll->rp_selq);
815 rpoll->rp_claimed = 0;
816}
817
818/*
819 * reservation_poll_fini(rpoll)
820 *
821 * Release any resource associated with reservation poll state.
822 */
823void
824reservation_poll_fini(struct reservation_poll *rpoll)
825{
826
827 KASSERT(rpoll->rp_claimed == 0);
828 seldestroy(&rpoll->rp_selq);
829 mutex_destroy(&rpoll->rp_lock);
830}
831
832/*
833 * reservation_poll_cb(fence, fcb)
834 *
835 * Callback to notify a reservation poll that a fence has
836 * completed. Notify any waiters and allow the next poller to
837 * claim the callback.
838 *
839 * If one thread is waiting for the exclusive fence only, and we
840 * spuriously notify them about a shared fence, tough.
841 */
842static void
843reservation_poll_cb(struct fence *fence, struct fence_cb *fcb)
844{
845 struct reservation_poll *rpoll = container_of(fcb,
846 struct reservation_poll, rp_fcb);
847
848 mutex_enter(&rpoll->rp_lock);
849 selnotify(&rpoll->rp_selq, 0, NOTE_SUBMIT);
850 rpoll->rp_claimed = 0;
851 mutex_exit(&rpoll->rp_lock);
852}
853
854/*
855 * reservation_object_poll(robj, events, rpoll)
856 *
857 * Poll for reservation object events using the reservation poll
858 * state in rpoll:
859 *
860 * - POLLOUT wait for all fences shared and exclusive
861 * - POLLIN wait for the exclusive fence
862 *
863 * Return the subset of events in events that are ready. If any
864 * are requested but not ready, arrange to be notified with
865 * selnotify when they are.
866 */
867int
868reservation_object_poll(struct reservation_object *robj, int events,
869 struct reservation_poll *rpoll)
870{
871 struct reservation_object_read_ticket ticket;
872 struct reservation_object_list *list;
873 struct fence *fence;
874 uint32_t i, shared_count;
875 int revents;
876 bool recorded = false; /* curlwp is on the selq */
877 bool claimed = false; /* we claimed the callback */
878 bool callback = false; /* we requested a callback */
879
880 /*
881 * Start with the maximal set of events that could be ready.
882 * We will eliminate the events that are definitely not ready
883 * as we go at the same time as we add callbacks to notify us
884 * that they may be ready.
885 */
886 revents = events & (POLLIN|POLLOUT);
887 if (revents == 0)
888 return 0;
889
890top:
891 /* Enter an RCU read section and get a read ticket. */
892 rcu_read_lock();
893 reservation_object_read_begin(robj, &ticket);
894
895 /* If we want to wait for all fences, get the shared list. */
896 if ((events & POLLOUT) && (list = robj->robj_list) != NULL) do {
897 /* Make sure the content of the list has been published. */
898 membar_datadep_consumer();
899
900 /* Find out how long it is. */
901 shared_count = list->shared_count;
902
903 /*
904 * Make sure we saw a consistent snapshot of the list
905 * pointer and length.
906 */
907 if (!reservation_object_read_valid(robj, &ticket))
908 goto restart;
909
910 /*
911 * For each fence, if it is going away, restart.
912 * Otherwise, acquire a reference to it to test whether
913 * it is signalled. Stop and request a callback if we
914 * find any that is not signalled.
915 */
916 for (i = 0; i < shared_count; i++) {
917 fence = fence_get_rcu(list->shared[i]);
918 if (fence == NULL)
919 goto restart;
920 if (!fence_is_signaled(fence)) {
921 fence_put(fence);
922 break;
923 }
924 fence_put(fence);
925 }
926
927 /* If all shared fences have been signalled, move on. */
928 if (i == shared_count)
929 break;
930
931 /* Put ourselves on the selq if we haven't already. */
932 if (!recorded)
933 goto record;
934
935 /*
936 * If someone else claimed the callback, or we already
937 * requested it, we're guaranteed to be notified, so
938 * assume the event is not ready.
939 */
940 if (!claimed || callback) {
941 revents &= ~POLLOUT;
942 break;
943 }
944
945 /*
946 * Otherwise, find the first fence that is not
947 * signalled, request the callback, and clear POLLOUT
948 * from the possible ready events. If they are all
949 * signalled, leave POLLOUT set; we will simulate the
950 * callback later.
951 */
952 for (i = 0; i < shared_count; i++) {
953 fence = fence_get_rcu(list->shared[i]);
954 if (fence == NULL)
955 goto restart;
956 if (!fence_add_callback(fence, &rpoll->rp_fcb,
957 reservation_poll_cb)) {
958 fence_put(fence);
959 revents &= ~POLLOUT;
960 callback = true;
961 break;
962 }
963 fence_put(fence);
964 }
965 } while (0);
966
967 /* We always wait for at least the exclusive fence, so get it. */
968 if ((fence = robj->robj_fence) != NULL) do {
969 /* Make sure the content of the fence has been published. */
970 membar_datadep_consumer();
971
972 /*
973 * Make sure we saw a consistent snapshot of the fence.
974 *
975 * XXX I'm not actually sure this is necessary since
976 * pointer writes are supposed to be atomic.
977 */
978 if (!reservation_object_read_valid(robj, &ticket))
979 goto restart;
980
981 /*
982 * If it is going away, restart. Otherwise, acquire a
983 * reference to it to test whether it is signalled. If
984 * not, stop and request a callback.
985 */
986 if ((fence = fence_get_rcu(fence)) == NULL)
987 goto restart;
988 if (fence_is_signaled(fence)) {
989 fence_put(fence);
990 break;
991 }
992
993 /* Put ourselves on the selq if we haven't already. */
994 if (!recorded) {
995 fence_put(fence);
996 goto record;
997 }
998
999 /*
1000 * If someone else claimed the callback, or we already
1001 * requested it, we're guaranteed to be notified, so
1002 * assume the event is not ready.
1003 */
1004 if (!claimed || callback) {
1005 revents = 0;
1006 break;
1007 }
1008
1009 /*
1010 * Otherwise, try to request the callback, and clear
1011 * all possible ready events. If the fence has been
1012 * signalled in the interim, leave the events set; we
1013 * will simulate the callback later.
1014 */
1015 if (!fence_add_callback(fence, &rpoll->rp_fcb,
1016 reservation_poll_cb)) {
1017 fence_put(fence);
1018 revents = 0;
1019 callback = true;
1020 break;
1021 }
1022 fence_put(fence);
1023 } while (0);
1024
1025 /* All done reading the fences. */
1026 rcu_read_unlock();
1027
1028 if (claimed && !callback) {
1029 /*
1030 * We claimed the callback but we didn't actually
1031 * request it because a fence was signalled while we
1032 * were claiming it. Call it ourselves now. The
1033 * callback doesn't use the fence nor rely on holding
1034 * any of the fence locks, so this is safe.
1035 */
1036 reservation_poll_cb(NULL, &rpoll->rp_fcb);
1037 }
1038 return revents;
1039
1040restart:
1041 rcu_read_unlock();
1042 goto top;
1043
1044record:
1045 rcu_read_unlock();
1046 mutex_enter(&rpoll->rp_lock);
1047 selrecord(curlwp, &rpoll->rp_selq);
1048 if (!rpoll->rp_claimed)
1049 claimed = rpoll->rp_claimed = true;
1050 mutex_exit(&rpoll->rp_lock);
1051 recorded = true;
1052 goto top;
1053}
1054
1055/*
1056 * reservation_object_kqfilter(robj, kn, rpoll)
1057 *
1058 * Kqueue filter for reservation objects. Currently not
1059 * implemented because the logic to implement it is nontrivial,
1060 * and userland will presumably never use it, so it would be
1061 * dangerous to add never-tested complex code paths to the kernel.
1062 */
1063int
1064reservation_object_kqfilter(struct reservation_object *robj, struct knote *kn,
1065 struct reservation_poll *rpoll)
1066{
1067
1068 return EINVAL;
1069}
